Subject: more re: repeated crawl failures
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=301098244; y=DojgkKGg11JltZHdK50oDTDq16ELt4fhTaHHIUow1p9BnBHpgLvsXmw

Thanks so much everyone, for responding.  I'm delighted to get such helpful=
 feedback, especially concerning the preprocessor PreconditionEnforcer.  I =
must admit that I had totally failed to report that all this started when I=
 did my initial crawls using all defaults (except the user-agent and from f=
ields, which I set legally and appropriately.)  I just repeated this origin=
al all-default crawl (with seed http://www.cs.nmt.edu), and saw it run to c=
ompletion in 52 ms.  It SEEMED an identical failure.

Now I'm not completel=
y sure where to find what relevant data, but once again 0 sites were visite=
d & 0 downloaded.  I started with the crawl-manifest and found a good list =
of all crawl activities.  The crawl.log was empty, the runtime-errors.log w=
as empty, the local-errors log was empty, the uri-errors.log was empty, the=
 progress-statics log showed 0 discovered, 0 queued, 0 downloaded, a doc/s =
of 0(0), a KB/s (ag) of 0(0), dl-failures =3D 0, busy-thread =3D 0, mem-use=
-KB =3D 14571, heap-size-KB =3D 23632, congestion =3D �, max-depth =
=3D -1, & avg-depth =3D 0.

The file order.xml looked fine to me, seeds.txt=
 said "http:/www.cs.nmt.edu", host-report.txt was empty, mimetype-report.tx=
t was empty, responsecode-report.txt was empty, seeds-report.txt was empty.=
   Crawl-report.txt showed the crawl finished in 52 ms., "Total Seeds Crawl=
ed: 0", "Total Seeds not Crawled: 0", "Total Hosts Crawled: -1", "Total Doc=
uments Crawled: 0", and all other statistics were 0.

I am only a newbie he=
re, but to me this says:  "Something didn't work somewhere for some reason.=
"  I was unable to find any other information of interest, and I'm hoping f=
or some clarification here.

All my environment remains the same as before.=
  Thanks for any suggestions.

-Rich B.
